page.title: 02CRICKET:HINTON CHARTERHOUSE
page.content: HINTON CHARTERHOUSE'S{CRICKET CLUB}IS ABOUT 90 YEARS OLD.IT PROVIDES THE MAIN FORM OF RECREATION FOR THE MEN IN THE VILLAGE,WHILE THE WIVES MAKE THE TEAS AND USE THE PAVILION FOR THEIR OWN PURPOSES. MANY ACTIVITIES ARE CENTRED AROUND THE CLUB,e.g.FETES AND JUMBLE SALES. HINTON CHARTERHOUSE'S POPULATION IS ALMOST COMPLETELY MADE UP OF ELDERLY PEOPLE. THIS MEANS THAT THE TEAM CONSISTS OF YOUNG PEOPLE FROM OUTSIDE THE VILLAGE, SO THERE IS LITTLE LOCAL COMPETITION TO BE IN THE TEAM. SEVERAL SOMERSET PLAYERS HAVE PLAYED FOR THE TEAM, WHICH HAS ONLY EVER WON 1 COMPETITION, THE SOMERSET COMPETITION. THE CLUB IS NOW IN THE WILTSHIRE LEAGUE. THE TEAM GOES ON TOURS ALL OVER THE COUNTRY AND MANY TOURING TEAMS PLAY AGAINST THEM, e.g. LEEDS POLICE AND RADLEY COLLEGE.
